evaluation.Q1: Does the chart effectively compare N, P, K values across different crops?

feedback.improvement: Bar chart format effectively showing N, P, K values for each crop
Improve x-axis labels to show actual crop names instead of numbers

evaluation.Q2: Are rice and wheat clearly distinguishable from other crops in the visualization?

feedback.improvement: Highlight rice and wheat bars with distinct colors or patterns
Add clear labels for rice and wheat directly on the chart

evaluation.Q3: Does the chart use a bar format to represent the average N, P, K values for each crop?

feedback.improvement: Bar format effectively represents N, P, K values for each crop

evaluation.Q4: Are the text annotations for rice and wheat clearly visible and accurate?

feedback.improvement: Include clear text annotations for wheat, showing its N, P, K values
Move rice annotation to be closer to its corresponding bars for better clarity

evaluation.Q5: Is the color scheme consistent and does it aid in differentiating between crops?

feedback.improvement: Consistent color scheme for N, P, K across all crops
Use more distinct colors for rice to highlight it as requested

evaluation.Q6: Are the axes clearly labeled, with crop names on the X-axis and N, P, K values on the Y-axis?

feedback.improvement: Replace crop type numbers with actual crop names on X-axis
Add a label for the Y-axis indicating 'Average Nutrient Value'

evaluation.Q7: Does the chart have a clear title that reflects its content?

feedback.improvement: Clear and descriptive title 'Average N, P, K Values for Different Crops'

evaluation.Q8: Are the N, P, K values for each crop visually grouped together?

feedback.improvement: N, P, K values for each crop are grouped together as adjacent bars

evaluation.Q9: Is there a legend explaining the color coding (if used) that doesn't obstruct the main chart?

feedback.improvement: Clear legend explaining color coding for N, P, K without obstructing the chart

evaluation.Q10: Is the overall layout of the chart efficient, with a good balance between data and white space?

feedback.improvement: Efficient use of space with good balance between data and white space
Slightly reduce white space at the top to make room for clearer crop labels

evaluation.Q11: Are all text elements, including labels and annotations, legible and consistent in style?

feedback.improvement: Consistent font style and size for all text elements
Increase font size of x-axis labels for better legibility

evaluation.Q12: Is the level of detail appropriate for agricultural researchers, farmers, and agronomists?

feedback.improvement: Appropriate level of detail showing N, P, K values for multiple crops
Include units of measurement for N, P, K values for more precise information

evaluation.Q13: Does the chart facilitate the identification of trends or patterns in nutrient requirements across crops?

feedback.improvement: Bar chart format allows for easy comparison of nutrient requirements across crops
Sort crops by a specific nutrient value to highlight trends more clearly

evaluation.Q14: Are there any overlapping elements that might hinder data interpretation?

feedback.improvement: Clear separation between bars and no overlapping elements

evaluation.Q15: If present, do grid lines enhance readability without detracting from the visualization?

feedback.improvement: Light grid lines enhance readability without overwhelming the data

evaluation.Q16: Is there a clear visual hierarchy that emphasizes rice and wheat while maintaining overall data integrity?

feedback.improvement: Highlight rice and wheat bars with distinct colors or patterns
Increase emphasis on rice and wheat through annotation placement or bar width

evaluation.Q17: Are the bars proportional to the data values they represent?

feedback.improvement: Bars are correctly proportional to their respective data values

evaluation.Q18: Does the chart avoid unnecessary visual elements that might distract from its main message?

feedback.improvement: Clean design without unnecessary decorative elements

evaluation.Q19: Can the Y-axis scale adequately represent the range of N, P, K values for all crops?

feedback.improvement: Y-axis scale from 0 to 200 adequately represents all N, P, K values

evaluation.Q20: Is the spacing between bars and groups sufficient for clear visual separation?

feedback.improvement: Adequate spacing between bars and groups for clear visual separation
